subject: RE: [junit] JFCUnit Test methods
msgSnippet: Here is a snippet of some test code to check that I get a JFileChooser dialog box appear when I click a button labelled Browse . This uses
messageBody:
Here is a snippet of some test code to check that I get a JFileChooser
dialog box appear when I click a button labelled "Browse". This uses
"enterClickAndLeave" to click the browse button...

JButton browse = (JButton)JFCTestHelper.findButton("Browse",
startFrame,
0);
JDialog chooserDialog;

assert(startFrame.isVisible());

JFCTestHelper.enterClickAndLeave(this, browse, 250L);

try {
chooserDialog = (JDialog)jfcHelper.getWindow("Open");
} catch(JFCTestException jfcte) {
fail("Cannot find chooser frame");
return;
}


-----Original Message-----
From: qionghua yang
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 29/06/01 16:26
Subject: [junit] JFCUnit Test methods

I have downloaded the JFCUnit and tried some methods.  I have
successfully tested the existing of my components, such as labels,
buttons.  Next I would like to test the actions of those buttons.  Could
anybody give me some hint or some sample codes on how to use
enterClickAndLeave() methods?  Thanks!
 
qionghua
